title: What is typewriter paper rest? - Quora

response.answer_text: “What is typewriter paper rest?” Typewriter Parts.  There you go. The typewriter paper rest is mounted behind the carriage to keep the paper up. Here you can see the paper rest in the middle behind the paper on a 1959 Olympia SM4:  With the Olympia SM, the paper rest is spring-loaded and hidden inside the carriage. By pushing the small button on the right hand side of the carriage the paper rest will spring into position and can be pulled out to show a measure that will tell you how many lines you can write before the end of the paper.  On the older machines, like the Olympia Progress below, the paper rest is folded over the machine when not in use:

The paper rest is an additional support that comes out of the paper table. It's most prominent on portable models such as the Corona S series. In most machines, like coronas and Olympias, they remain hidden behind or in the paper table until they are popped up. On some machines like the Erika, they collapse flat over the top of the machine. Occasionally they are graded, but their main purpose is to keep the page upright as it feeds into the machine.

This is the device that sticks up behind the typewriter’s platen to support the page as it advances upward as you type. It helps keep your typing visible as you progress so you don't have to reach behind the typewriter and pull the paper up as it flops backward.
